REF AD2.22.5.1.3 COORDINATION WITH NETWORK : READ : 'CDG AIRPORT PDS IS DIRECTLY CONNECTED WITH THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER (NMOC) FOR DATA EXCHANGE (COLLABORATIVE MANAGEMENT OF FLIGHT UPDATES). DATA ARE AUTOMATICALLY EXCHANGED THROUGH DPI AND API MESSAGES, WHICH INCLUDE TARGET TAKE-OFF TIMES, TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT BY NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR EN ROUTE TRAFFIC PREDICTION AND FOR SLOT ALLOCATION. DATA ARE AUTOMATICALLY EXCHANGED THROUGH DPI MESSAGES, WHICH INCLUDE TARGET TAKE-OFF TIMES, TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT BY NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR EN ROUTE TRAFFIC PREDICTION AND FOR SLOT ALLOCATION. SX0163/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT LFPG/PARIS/CHARLES DE GAULLE VALIDITY:16SEP24-20OCT24 RECONFIGURATION WORKS ON AIRCRAFT STATION U10 AND REFURBISHMENT OF A SECTION OF TAXIWAY A. THIS WORK REQUIRES THE CLOSURE OF A SECTION OF TAXIWAY A 24 HOURS PER DAY. PHASE 1: TAXIWAY A BETWEEN STANDS S24 AND S30 24 HOURS PER DAY: AIRCRAFT STANDS CLOSED 24 HOURS PER DAY: U10 S24 TO S30 IMPACT ON OPERATIONS : THE CLOSURE OF A SECTION OF TAXIWAY A BETWEEN AIRCRAFT STANDS S24 TO S30 CREATES A DEAD-END: - ONLY AIRCRAFT OPERATING TERMINAL 1 AND SIERRA STANDS CAN ACCESS TAXIWAY A IN ITS WESTERN SECTION - ONLY AIRCRAFT OPERATING TERMINAL 1 STANDS CAN ACCESS TAXIWAY A3 - NOTE THAT TAXIWAY A3 IS RESTRICTED TO AIRCRAFT WITH A MAXIMUM WINGSPAN OF 61M - S23 AIRCRAFT STAND IS LIMITED TO AIRCRAFT WITH A MAXIMUM WINGSPAN OF 36M. THE AIRCRAFT STANDS LISTED BELOW AND LOCATED NEAR THE WORK ZONE ARE SUBJECT TO SPECIAL PUSH-BACK PROCEDURES: U07: RED PUSH MANDATORY ON TAXIWAY A S23: PUSH-BACK ON TAXIWAY A HEADING WEST PROHIBITED. PUSH-BACK HEADING SOUTH ON TAXIWAY A3 ALLOWED FOR DEPARTURE TO TAXIWAY A S31: PUSH-BACK ON TAXIWAY A HEADING EAST PROHIBITED. PUSH-BACK ON TAXIWAY A HEADING SOUTH ALLOWED FOR DEPARTURE TO TAXIWAY NA1. THE AIRCRAFT STANDS LISTED BELOW ARE SUBJECT TO RED PUSH PROCEDURES ONLY: X03 Y03 Y05 Y08 Z03 Z04 Z05 Z07 Z09 THE AIRCRAFT STANDS LISTED BELOW ARE SUBJECT TO THE WEST HEADING PUSH-BACK PROCEDURES ONLY: S06 TO S22 THE AIRCRAFT STANDS LISTED BELOW ARE SUBJECT TO WEST HEADING TOWING PROCEDURES ONLY: S6B S7B S8B S9B

THE CHAPTER 22.2.3 IS UPDATED ACCORDINGLY: 22.2.3 COORDINATION WITH NETWORK ORLY AIRPORT PDS IS DIRECTLY CONNECTED TO THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER (NMOC) FOR DATA EXCHANGE (COLLABORATIVE MANAGEMENT OF FLIGHT UPDATES). DATA ARE AUTOMATICALLY EXCHANGED THROUGH DPI AND API MESSAGES WHICH INCLUDE TARGET TAKE-OFF TIME AND ESTIMED LANDING TIME, TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT BY THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR EN-ROUTE TRAFFIC PREDICTION AND FOR SLOT ALLOCATION. DIFFERENT TYPES OF DPI AND API ARE: -GENERAL ARRIVAL PLANNING INFORMATION (G-API) -PREDICTED DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (P-DPI) -EARLY DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (E-DPI) -TARGET DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (T-DPI) -ATC DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (A-DPI) -CANCEL DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (C-DPI) THE REA MESSAGE IS NO LONGER TO BE USED REA AS IT IS REPLACED BY DPI MESSSAGES SYSTEMATICALLY AND AUTOMATICALLY SENT. REF AIP AD2 22.2.3

SX0089/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT LFPB/PARIS/LE BOURGET MODIFICATION AIP FRANCE AD2 LFPB REGARDING SB CONVENTIONAL DEP PROC FM PARIS - LE BOURGET FURTHER TO PTV VOR AND NDB POY EXTINCTION VALIDITY: 13JUN24- 30OCT24 VOR PTV FM THE 12/29/2022 RPLC BY THE WPT (5LNC) OLZOM, NDB POY FM 15/06/23 RPLC BY WPT OXCEL. RESULTS IN THE MODIFICATION OF THE SB CONVENTIONAL DEP PROC BASED ON THIS AID.TEMPO OPR PROC ARE IMPLEMENTED IN ORDER TO HANDLE THE SB DEP ACFT, WHILE AWAITING THE DESIGN OF NEW RNAV STD INITIAL DEP PROC - ALL SID PTV DEP LFPB ARE REMOVED. - ALL SIDS USING POY DEP FM LE BOURGET ARE AFFECTED BY THE EXTINCTION OF NDB POY. SOME INITIAL PARTS OF SID MONOT AND DORDI DEP FM LFPB ARE NOT AFFECTED AND THEREFORE REMAIN USABLE.THE NEW WP OXCEL REPLACES POY AND MUST BE INPUT IN NAVIGATION SYSTEMS OF AIRPLANES DEPARTING FROM LE BOURGET THAT USE THESE ROUTES. ******************************** DEP 07/09 TO OLZOM / MONOT WITH SID LFPB 5J IN FORCE - SID CONV MONOT 5J NOT USABLE - SID DORDI 5J REMAINS USABLE - THE FLW DEP CLR CONFIRMED BY AD DELIVERY : FLW DEP SID CONV DORDI 5J CMB 3000 FT AMSL, UP TO D 17.1 NM FM MLN, THEN EXP VECTORING TO OLZOM OR MONOT - RADIOCOMMUNICATION FAILURE : SQUAWK 7600 FLW DEP SID CONV DORDI 5J CMB 3000 FT AMSL, UP TO D 17.1 NM FM MLN, THEN PCD DCT OLZOM OR MONOT COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE ******************************** DEP 07/09 TO OLZOM / MONOT WITH SID LFPB 5M IN FORCE - SID DORDI 5M NOT USABLE - SID MONOT 5M REMAINS USABLE IN ITS INITIAL PART UP TO RADIAL 073 TSU INCLUDED. - THE FLW DEP CLR CONFIRMED BY AD DELIVERY : FLW THE INITIAL PART OF THE DEP SID MONOT 5M CMB FL 070, THEN INTERCEPT AND FLW THE 073 TSU (MAG 253), THEN PSG BT 180 RADIAL TURN LEFT MAG 190, THEN EXP VECTORING TO OXCEL THEN OLZOM OR MONOT OR DORDI - RADIOCOMMUNICATION FAILURE : SQUAWK 7600 FLW THE INITIAL PART OF THE DEP SID MONOT 5M CMB FL 070, THEN INTERCEPT AND FLW THE 073 TSU (MAG 253), THEN PSG BT 180 RADIAL TURN LEFT MAG 190 TOWARDS OXCEL, THEN PCD DCT TO OLZOM OR MONOT OR DORDI COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE ******************************** DEP 25 TO OLZOM / MONOT/ DORDI WITH SID LFPB 5C AND 5F IN FORCE - PARTS OF SID MONOT 5C / 5F AND DORDI 5C / 5F ARE NO LONGER USABLE AFT 12 NM FM BT. - THE FLW DEP CLR CONFIRMED BY AD DELIVERY : FLW THE INITIAL PART OF THE DEP SID CONV MONOT 5C OR 5F CMB 4000 FT AMSL ON RADIAL BT 245 RADIAL, THEN AT 12 NM FM BT, TURN LEFT MAG 123 THEN EXP VECTORING TO OXCEL THEN OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI. - RDO COM FAILURE: SQUAWK 7600 FLW THE INITIAL PART OF THE DEP SID CONV MONOT 5C OR 5F CMB 4000 FT AMSL ON BT 245 RADIAL, THEN AT 12 NM FM BT, PCD DCT OXCEL THEN DCT OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE ******************************** DEP TO RWY 21 TO OLZOM/ MONOT/ DORDI W WITH SID 5C AND 5F - DEP CLR TO BE EXP : INITIAL DEP AGOPA 5P CMB 4000 FT AMSL THEN, ENR TO PB253, INTERCEPT BT 245 RADIAL, THEN AT 12 NM FM BT, TURN LEFT MAG TRACK 123, THEN EXP VECTORING TO OXCEL THEN OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI. - RDO COM FAILURE : SQUAWK 7600 FLW INITIAL DEP AGOPA 5P CMB 4000 FT AMSL THEN, ENR TO PB253, INTERCEPT BT 245 RADIAL , THEN AT 12 NM FM BT, TURN LEFT DCT OXCEL THEN PCD DCT OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE ******************************************* DEP TO RWY 21 TO OLZOM/ MONOT/ DORDI E WITH SID 5J -DEP CLR TO BE EXP : INITIAL DEP AGOPA 5Q CMB 3000 FT AMSL THEN, ENR TO PB093, INTERCEPT MLN 360 RADIAL, THEN EXP VECTORING TO OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI. - RDO COM FAILURE : SQUAWK 7600. FLW INITIAL DEP AGOPA 5Q CMB 3000 FT AMSL THEN, ENR TO PB093, INTERCEPT MLN 360 RADIAL, THEN AT 17.1 NM FM MLN PCD DCT OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE *************************************************** DEP TO RWY 21 TO OLZOM/ MONOT/ DORDI E WITH SID 5M -DEP CLR TO BE EXP : INITIAL DEP AGOPA 5Q CMB FL 070, THEN ENR TO PB093, TURN RIGHT TO INTERCEPT TSU 073 RADIAL, THEN PSG BT 180 RADIAL TURN LEFT MAG 190, THEN EXP VECTORING TO OXCEL THEN OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI. - RDO COM FAILURE : SQUAWK 7600. FLW INITIAL DEP AGOPA 5Q CMB FL 070, THEN ENR TO PB093, TURN RIGHT TO INTERCEPT TSU 073 RADIAL, THEN PSG BT 180 RADIAL TURN LEFT DCT OXCEL THEN PCD DCT OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE. ********************************************* MODIFICATION TO AD2 LFPB 2.22.3.4 PILOTS MUST APPLY THE FLW PROC : SPECIFY PLN BOX 15 : - FOR DEP TO OLZOM : DCT OLZOM (WHATEVER THE TKOF RWY) - FOR ALL MONOT EXIT DEP : DCT MONOT (WHATEVER THE TKOF RWY) - FOR ALL DORDI EXIT DEP : DCT DORDI (WHATEVER THE TKOF RWY)

ADS-B DATA FOR ECRA (EUROPEAN CONNECTED REGIONAL AIRPORTS PROGRAMME) OPERATIONS. 1.1.IN ORDER TO COOPERATE WITH ADS-B RECEIVER USED BY AIRPORT OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL FOR USE OF THE ECRA PROGRAMME AT EINDHOVEN AIRPORT,PILOTS OF MODE S EQUIPPED ACFT WITH ADS-B FUNCTIONALITIES WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND SHALL: A)SELECT AUTO MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE OR B)IF AUTOMODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON (E.G.XPDR) AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE. -FROM THE REQUEST FOR TOWER PUSH-BACK OR TAXI,WHICHEVER IS EARLIER -AFTER LANDING,CONTINUOUSLY UNTIL THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED IN ITS STAND. -WHEN THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED, FLT CREW SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2.WHENEVER THE ACFT IS CAPABLE OF REPORTING ACFT IDENTIFICATION (I.E.CALLSIGN USED IN FLT), THIS SHOULD BE ENTERED (THROUGH THE FMS OR THE TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE REQUEST FOR TOWED PUSH-BACK OR TAXI, WHICHEVER IS EARLIER. 1.1.3.AIR CREW MUST USE THE ICAO DEFINED FORMAT TO ENTER THE ACFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4.TO ENSURE THAT THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQ (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS) IS NOT COMPROMISED, TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP, AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RWY.

DEPARTURE FLIGHTS MODIFIED : THE NICE COTE D'AZUR AIRPORT ESTABLISHES A PERMANENT AND AUTOMATIC DATA EXCHANGE WITH THE NETWORK MANAGEMENT OPERATIONS CENTRE AS AN 'ANI' AIRPORT (ADVANCED NETWORK INTEGRATED), IN ADDITION TO THE EXISTING 'ACDM' (AIRPORT COLLABORATIVE DECISION MAKING) MESSAGE EXCHANGE. AN 'ANI' AIRPORT HAS FULLY ADOPTED THE AIRPORT-'CDM' (COLLABORATIVE DECISION MAKING) CONCEPT BY PROVIDING TO 'NMOC' THE FULL SET OF 'DPI' MESSAGES (DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION: 'PDPI, EDPI, TDPIT, TDPIS, ADPI AND CDPI') AND 'GAPI' MESSAGES (GENERAL ARRIVAL PLANNING INFORMATION). THIS ACTIVATION ADDITIONALLY COVERS THE INTEGRATION OF NEW 'TTOT' VALUES ('TTTOT, ETTOT, CTTOT') IN 'EDPI', 'TDPIT', 'TDPIS' MESSAGES. WITH THE INTRODUCTION OF 'PDPI', NEW VALUES IN 'DPI' AND 'GAPI' MESSAGES EXCHANGES WITH EUROCONTROL SYSTEMS, THE ATFM NETWORK MAY BE IMPACTED AS EARLY AS 48 HOURS BEFORE EOBT AND MAY BE USED FOR AIR TRAFFIC FLOW MANAGEMENT (ATFM) PURPOSES. REF AIP AD2 LFMN.22.4

WITH REFERENCE TO ITALIAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY (ENAC)PROVISION 4 JUN 2024, DUE TO REDUCED AVAILABILITY OF AIRCRAFT PARKING STANDS FOR NOT SCHEDULED FLIGHTS, THE MANAGEMENT OF DIVERTED FLIGHTS ON ARRIVAL WILL TAKE PLACE AS FOLLOWS: 1)IN ORDER TO SAFEGUARD THE AVAILABILITY OF PARKING STANDS FOR FLIGHTS REGULARLY SCHEDULED AT THE AIRPORT, THE DIVERTED FLIGHTS, AFTER LANDING, WILL BE PARKED ON THE APRON ONLY IN THE PRESENCE OF APPROPRIATE PARKING STANDS AVAILABLE FOR AT LEAST 2 HOURS (OR EVEN LONGER DEPENDING ON CURRENT OPERATIONAL SITUATION). IN THE ABSENCE OF SUCH TIPOLOGY OF AIRCRAFT STAND, DIVERTED FLIGHTS COULD BE SUBJECT TO LONG LASTING WAIT IN THE MOVEMENT AREA (EVEN A FEW HOURS), WITHOUT THE POSSIBILITY OF DISEMBARKING PASSENGERS, BAGS AND FREIGHT 2)THE CREW OF DIVERTED FLIGHTS PARKED IN THE MOVEMENT AREA ARE REQUESTED TO CONTACT HANDLER'S VHF FREQUENCY TO COMMUNICATE ANY REDUCTION IN EXPECTED ETD FROM THE AIRPORT, IN ORDER TO ALLOW THE AERODROME OPERATOR TO RE-EVALUATE THE AVAILABILITY OF AIRCRAFT STANDS ON THE APRON REF AIP AD 2 LIPE 1-23 ITEM 2.20 'LOCAL AERODROME REGULATIONS'

Paragraph.Text: AX0002/20 AIC RESTRICTION HLLL/TRIPOLI FIR THE PILOT OF THE AIRCRAFT OPERATING IN THE LIBYAN AIR SPACE A. THE LIBYAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY STRESSES THE PILOT OF AIRCRAFT OPERATING OUTSIDE THE FIELD OF HIGH COMMUNICATIONS FOR THE NECESSITY OF USING VHF/ RT RANGE .RADIO FREQUENCY ASSIGNED TO EXCHANGE INFORMATION BETWEEN PILOTS VHF AIR / AIR VOLINTARY REPORT. B. FOR MORE COORDINATION BETWEEN THE OPPOSING AIR TRAFFIC, ESPECIALLY THOSE OPERATING OUTSIDE THE CONTROLLED AIRSPACE, IN ORDER TO ENSURE THE SAFETY OF AIR NAVIGATION IN THE LIBYAN AVIATION TERRITORY AND THE MENTIONED RADIO FREQUENCIES ARE: 1- WHEN FLYING AT OR BELOW THE FLYING LEVEL FL200 FREQUENCY 123.5 MHZ 2- WHEN FLYING ABOVE A FLIGHT LEVEL FL200 FREQUENCY 126.9 MHZ C. THIS AUTHORITY ALSO STRESSES THE NEED TO OBTAIN PRIOR PERMISSION FOR FLIGHTS BEFORE TAKING OFF FROM AIRPORTS THAT ARE NOT SUBJECT TO THE MAJOR AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL CENTERS IN TRIPOLI AND ITS BRANCH IN BENGHAZI BY WAY OF HIGH-FREQUENCY RADIO
